    notes

    Introduction to quantum mechanics

    Published: June 01, 2022

    Last modified: May 02, 2024

    An introductory note to quantum mechanics and statistical physics. This note was originally intended to help out students of CentraleSupélec in their first year. However, it has been refined and should be accessible to any student with some background of linear algebra and a basic comprehension of physics (a bit of knowledge about electromagnetism should help to appreciate the full scope of this note).

    Introduction to quantum field thoery

    Published: September 09, 2022

    Last modified: May 02, 2024

    An introductory note to the canonical formalism of quantum field theory. Quantum field theory is the most succesful theory of modern physics. In its more advanced form it allows to account for almost every observation. It is an almost complete model for particle physics. We are now sure that quantum field theory can’t be the full story, as it doesn’t explain neutrinos masses or dark matter for instance.

    Scattering of Bloch electrons

    Published: May 02, 2024

    Last modified: May 02, 2024

    These few pages represent an example on how one can use quantum mecahnics and Fermi’s golden rule to derive scattering amplitudes for certain processes.\

    Basics of quantum mechanics

    Published: May 02, 2024

    Last modified: May 02, 2024

    This extremely short note is aimed at beginner students who wish to tackcle the topic of Quantum Mechanics. It puts the emphasize on the postulate of Quantum Mechanics and aims to draw a clear link between the formulation of Quantum Mechanics and linear algebra. \
